channel.title: Tech on DW's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Tech on DW's Blog

item.title: Type conversions in C++
item.description: Implicit conversion Type casting dynamic_cast static_cast const_cast Implicit conversion This will automatically perform when a value is copied to a compatible type. For example: short a = 2000; int b; b = a; The given example is also know as standard conversion Conversions that may not be able to represent the same value If a negative integer value is converted to an unsigned type. E.g. unsigned char a = -1; // a = 255

item.title: Guide of Hugo
item.description: I will just choose directories you might use: archetypes this is the directory contains preconfigured front matter and possibly also a content disposition for your website's content types. There are several parameters you can set. config This file will define the behaviour of Hugo which is related to the style of your site. If you have multiple config files, you can create a configuration directory to store them. You can choose to override the dault file with one or multiple site config files using the command line --config switch.
